projects.title: AI-ECG model for Cardiac Amyloidosis detection
projects.milestone: Granted Breakthrough Device Designation from FDA
projects.details: Leading a dedicated team, we developed an advanced AI-ECG model capable of detecting Cardiac Amyloidosis. Utilizing complex EHR data, we employed various data science techniques, and crafted a powerful CNN-based final model for accurate identification of CA from ECGs. Notably, this project involved significant collaborations with industry leaders like Pfizer, fostering groundbreaking advancements in healthcare.

projects.title: Leveraging EHR Data for Non-Small Cell Lung Cancer Patient Identification
projects.details: By harnessing large-scale structured and unstructured EHR data, I developed a robust methodology to identify Non-Small Cell Lung Cancer patients. Additionally, when machine learning models struggled with accurately extracting positive sentiment, I devised innovative techniques to enhance their predictive capabilities. Moreover, I standardized disease cohort creation strategies, offering company-wide applicability, thus advancing companies disease model strategies.

projects.title: Unveiling the Genomic Diversity of Delta Variant during COVID-19
projects.details: Amidst the COVID-19 pandemic, our research honed in on the Delta Variant, transcending the focus on Spike proteins. We pioneered a novel approach to detect the extensive genomic diversity within Delta Variant's COVID proteins. Our findings were later validated by fellow researchers, solidifying the significance of our initial observations during those critical times.

projects.title: Modular RNA-seq Pipeline for Large-Scale Data Analysis
projects.details: In the realm of zebrafish developmental genomics, I constructed a comprehensive modular RNA-seq pipeline to analyze vast amounts of RNA-seq data. Leveraging a diverse set of available tools and implementing a workflow language with robust horizontal scaling capabilities, the pipeline facilitated efficient and scalable processing.

projects.title: Mathematical Modelling of Lipid Signalling
projects.milestone: Submitted PhD thesis and published manuscript.
projects.details: Through the development of a mathematical model focusing on the PIP2 cycle, a key component of lipid signalling, I shed light on the intricate nature of Drosophila phototransduction lipid signalling. This model not only brought clarity to the regulation of lipid processes but also paved the way for new experimental directions, offering valuable insights into this complex system.
